definition: to look down upon/to despise
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
(negative prefix)/not/no

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: Mockups will be looked upon more favourably.
sentences.chinese: 實物模型會看不起更有利。

sentences.english: I shocked a lot of things heart, afraid other people look down on their own.
sentences.chinese: 好多東西讓我怛心，好怕別人看不起自已。

sentences.english: He held them in contempt for behaving in such a cowardly way.
sentences.chinese: 他看不起他們，因爲他們這樣膽小怕事。

sentences.english: I wish you wouldn't look down on this kind of work.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你不要看不起這種工作。

sentences.english: Do not look down on non-P arty people, for they can master the lessons of our experience very quickly.
sentences.chinese: 不要看不起黨外人士，我們的經驗他們很快就可學會。

sentences.english: Now, some people might look down on worm's nechanics, call it immoral.
sentences.chinese: 可能有些人看不起蟲子出老千，認爲這是不道德的。

sentences.english: Latty made little of Jane's new dress because she was jealous.
sentences.chinese: 拉蒂看不起簡的新裙子，困爲她很妒嫉。

sentences.english: He was looked down upon because of his poor family.
sentences.chinese: 他因家窮而被人看不起。

sentences.english: They were very often despised because of the very widespread practice of child marriages.
sentences.chinese: 由於普遍的童婚行爲，她們常常被人看不起。

sentences.english: You shouldn't look down upon him because he is poor.
sentences.chinese: 你不應該因爲一個人窮就看不起他。

sentences.english: I look down on those who eat the bread of idleness.
sentences.chinese: 我看不起那些吃閒飯的人。

sentences.english: Nana despises Yijia when she finds out that Big Foot is her father.
sentences.chinese: 娜娜發現大腳是怡嘉的父親後立刻看不起怡嘉。

sentences.english: He despised people who were lavish with their praises .
sentences.chinese: 他看不起那些阿諛奉承的人。

sentences.english: It is better to be looked over than overlooked.
sentences.chinese: 被人仰視總比被人看不起要強的多。

sentences.english: But I can’t understand why even the nuns despised her.
sentences.chinese: 可是我不太明白爲什麼那些修女也看不起她。

sentences.english: They are also looked down upon by your FICO credit score and other lenders.
sentences.chinese: 他們也看不起你的信用信用評分，其他放款。

definition: to look down upon/to hold in contempt
to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
cannot bear to see/to hate/to dislike/to disapprove
to show respect for/to think highly of
to jeer at/to deride/to ridicule/mockery/derision
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to belittle/to scorn/to take sth lightly
to snort disdainfully/to scoff at/to turn up one's nose
to despise/to look down upon/despicable
contempt/contemptuous/to despise/to scorn/scornful
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
to be self-interested
to loathe/to despise/contempt
to loathe/to hate/disgusted with sth
